headline.main: SENATE BILL LETS 3,000 STAY CITIZENS; Measure Is Passed to Guard Some Naturalized Nationals Living Outside of Country 1940 ACT NOW IN EFFECT Enforcement Would Deprive of U. S. Status Those Abroad Beyond Legal Time Limit

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 13 -- The Senate acted today to permit 3,000 to 5,000 of the naturalized Americans living abroad to retain their citizenship, which would have been forfeit, under the terms of the Nationality Act of 1940, if they were not in the United States by midnight tonight.
